channel.title: How-To on Alexandru Dinu
channel.description: Recent content in How-To on Alexandru Dinu

item.title: Blog Setup
item.description: Setup Link to heading This repo is organised with two branches: the main branch contains code needed to build the final site which resides in the gh-pages branch, following instructions from here: ┌──────────────┐ ┌──────────────────┐ │ branch: main │ ┌►│ branch: gh-pages │ ├──────────────┤ │ ├──────────────────┤ │ ./content │ │ │ ./index.html │ │ ... │ │ │ ./sitemap.xmp │ │ ./public ────┼──┘ │ ... │ └──────────────┘ └──────────────────┘ In the GitHub repo settings, under “Page”, you have to set the branch from which the site is being built, in my case: gh-pages.
